sentences.en: "Could I have a word?" — "Oh dear, if you must."
sentences.cn: “我能说一句吗？”——“亲爱的，如果你非说不可的话，好吧。”

sentences.en: "Oh dear, oh dear." McKinnon sighed. "You, too."
sentences.cn: “哎呀，哎呀！”麦金农叹息道，“你也一样。”

sentences.en: "Ooh dear me, that's a bit of a racist comment isn't it."
sentences.cn: “嗬，天哪！那评论有点种族歧视，不是吗？”

sentences.en: "Well, dear," her hostess would reply with a frigid smile.
sentences.cn: “噢，亲爱的，”她的女主人会笑容僵硬地回答。

sentences.en: Any time you want a babysitter, dear, you only have to ask.
sentences.cn: 亲爱的，你什么时候需要人帮忙照看孩子，只要开口说一声就行。

sentences.en: At last I am back at my dear little desk.
sentences.cn: 我终于回到了我那张可爱的小桌子旁。

sentences.en: Dear Madam, Thank you for your interest in our Memorial Scheme.
sentences.cn: 尊敬的女士，感谢您对我们的纪念方案的关注。

sentences.en: Dear Meg, ...
sentences.cn: 亲爱的梅格，…

sentences.en: Dear Mrs. Wilson, ...
sentences.cn: 尊敬的威尔逊夫人，…

sentences.en: Dear Sir or Madam, ...
sentences.cn: 尊敬的先生或女士，…

sentences.en: I made for the life raft and hung on for dear life.
sentences.cn: 我游到救生筏前，死命地抓住它。

sentences.en: It's eight-fifteen, dear, and your breakfast's ready.
sentences.cn: 8点15分了，亲爱的，你的早餐已经做好了。

sentences.en: Marcia had referred to him as a dear friend.
sentences.cn: 马西娅把他称作好朋友。

sentences.en: My dear man, you are welcome to stay.
sentences.cn: 我的老弟，欢迎你留下来。

sentences.en: Oh dear, I’ve broken the lamp.
sentences.cn: 天啊，我把灯打碎了。

sentences.en: Oh dear, there's the doorbell. See who it is, would you, darling.
sentences.cn: 哦，天哪，门铃响了。看看是谁好吗，亲爱的。

sentences.en: Outside, Bruce glanced at his watch: "Dear me, nearly oneo'clock."
sentences.cn: 出了门，布鲁斯瞥了一眼自己的手表，“天哪，快一点了。”

sentences.en: They're too dear.
sentences.cn: 它们的价格太高了。

sentences.en: What would you have done in my place, my dear?
sentences.cn: 亲爱的，你如果处在我的位置会怎么做？

sentences.en: You're a lot like me, dear.
sentences.cn: 你和我太像了，亲爱的。

phrases.phrase: dear john letter (from woman to man)

phrases.tran_cn: 尊敬的先生或女士（信笺的开头语）

trans.tran_en: used before someone’s name or title to begin a letter
used to show that you are surprised, upset, or annoyed because something bad has happened
You can call someone dear as a sign of affection
